page.title: 02CARNFORTH PARISH CHURCH
page.content: Before{Carnforth Parish Church}was built services were held in the small C.of E. School on Haws Hill. The population increased greatly when the Ironworks were built (1864) and public meetings were held to raise money.In 1870 a Lancaster Rd. site was bought and building started. The initial building was small and was consecrated on 14-8-1873. By 1890 the population had trebled. The church was again too small. A North aisle 20'x 60' was built, the west wall was moved further west, and a new vicarage was built on North Rd. By 1909 the chancel and vestry had been enlarged, a new roof put on, a transept built for the organ and a tower and peal of bells added. There have been no further structural additions since, but a new vicarage has been built on North Rd. opposite the new{Christ Church School.
